events.message: I have just filed a claim regarding a car accident I was involved in yesterday evening on Elm Street. The other vehicle collided with mine at the intersection.
The claim was reviewed and categorised under Auto Accident based on the initial information about the collision and vehicle damage.
An agent has been assigned to my case and contacted me to gather further details about the auto accident and assess the next steps.
I received an official acknowledgment from the insurance company confirming that my auto accident claim has been registered.
The insurance agent requested submission of the police report, photos of the vehicle damage, and a copy of the driver's license.
I have uploaded all requested documents including the police report and detailed images showing both vehicles after the collision.
The investigation into the car accident claim has started, with inspectors assigned to review the submitted evidence and vehicle damages.
The investigation concluded and all facts regarding the collision and liability were reviewed to determine the claim's validity.
A settlement offer was made covering the repair costs for my vehicle. The proposal appears fair according to the damage assessment.
I provided feedback on the settlement offer expressing satisfaction with the promptness and completeness of the claim handling.
The insurance claim for the auto accident was officially approved, confirming the acceptance of the settlement terms.
Payment for the approved claim has been issued directly to the auto repair shop as per the agreed settlement.
The claim has been officially closed after successful payment and repair of my vehicle was completed without issues.
All documents and communications related to the auto accident claim have been archived for future reference if needed.
